p.s: The novel The Hate U Give written by Angie Thomas and published by Cornelsen in 2019 is about Starr Carter, a sixteen year old, black girl who is confronted with racism and social differences in her neighborhood and school and when her friend Khalil gets shot by a police officer in the third chapter of the book.
The given excerpt is from the pages 328 to 332 nearly at the end of the book.
The scene takes place in Garden Heights where people are protesting against the injustice as the officer is not charged for killing Khalil.
In the beginning (ll. 1-9) Starr, her siblings and her friends come to the protest as well.

Ms. Ofrah, StarrsStarr's former attourneyattorney is somehow leading the protest, standing on a car and raising a hairbrush (ll. 10-15) when one shouts A hairbrush is not a gun Starr and her friends join in (ll. 16-23).
As Ms. Ofrah notices them she goes to them and asks why they are there and Starr tells her, they want to do something as well.
Ms. Ofrah explains to Starr what she really can do and that is to speak up (ll. 24-40).
Starr does as she is told and does not keep quiet, but speaks up for Khalil (ll. 41-61).
